medical_history.chief_complaint: A mass in the left ureter and cytologic evaluations of urine specimens positive for transitional-cell carcinoma.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Eight years earlier, the patient experienced two episodes of gross hematuria, leading to a diagnosis of transitional-cell carcinoma of the right renal pelvis. Three and a half years before this evaluation, cytologic examination of urine specimens showed cells consistent with transitional-cell carcinoma, with subsequent examinations failing to identify abnormalities until significant imaging findings were noted 16 months prior to this evaluation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of transitional-cell carcinoma of the right ureter, benign prostatic hypertrophy, goiter, heart murmur, and atrial fibrillation. Allergic to sulfa drugs.
medical_history.family_history: Father had lung cancer and died at age 48, a brother had lung cancer and died of acute myocardial infarction at age 61; both men smoked heavily. Mother died at age 98.
medical_history.social_history: Retired, married with two children, consumed alcohol occasionally, and stopped smoking a pipe more than 20 years ago.
